Scholarships open January 20th 2025! Apply by February 10th. Learn more here.

What do our students think of the Intro to R course?

Students overwhelmingly approve: 4.7 out of 5 stars from 490 surveyed participants.

Overall, students said the following about our course delivery:

I’ve taken several R classes, and this is the best R training I’ve ever had!
US CDC Epidemic Intelligence Service (EIS) Officer
Program is really well structured. I really enjoyed the code-along sessions immediately after or during the lecture. Exercises are well thought out.
Epidemiologist, Philippines
Inspirational instructors. I cannot recommend highly enough.
Epidemiology team lead
Superbly structured by experienced epidemiologists
Senior epidemiologist, UK Health Agency
No matching items

Students also said this about the relevance of the course to epidemiologists:

Applied Epi’s Introduction to R Course is THE best course for applied epidemiologists and other public health practitioners. The instructors work in public health and know exactly what the participants need to learn and provide concrete examples that can be immediately applied to existing workflows.
FETP coordinator, Philippines
I took the Coursera course - this is SO MUCH BETTER. It is so much more tailored to my direct needs. I don’t think like a programmer, I think like an epidemiologst, so this is much more intuitive
US local epidemiologist
This course addressed the problems on my mind, those day-to-day challenges. Other R courses are far too fast or abstract - this is the first I’ve taken where I actually want to continue!… in 1 hour, we resolved R problems I’ve had for 1 year!
Mentor, Liberia Field Epi Training Program
A few years back we did a training from a software company - this is an order of magnitude more useful because you’re teaching what we actually do.
Consultant Epidemiologist, Public Heatlh Wales
No matching items

And importantly, here are some student comments on the impact of the course:

This course put me lightyears ahead in only 5 days!
Epidemiologist, Save the Children
I am happy to report that after the course, the office is now routinely using R!
Epidemiologist, Belize
In a world that is so inequitable, R is a great equaliser. I feel very empowered by this training.
Epidemiologist, Country of Georgia
I now feel well equipped to independently create reproducible, descriptive epidemiological summaries in R at pace. No more manual reports!
UK FETP Fellow
The course literally changed my life
Epidemiologist, Public Health Wales
This course showed me that it was not only possible to use R for a beginner like me but that it was a powerful tool for frontline workers to produce reporting, analyze real world data and advance public health.
UK FETP Fellow
No matching items

Agencies we support

Applied Epi has delivered live training to personnel affiliated with over 400 agencies worldwide:

International organisations and NGOs

The World Health Organization (WHO), Doctors without Borders (MSF), European CDC (ECDC), International Federation of the Red Cross (IFRC), Resolve to Save Lives (RSL), Vital Strategies, Save the Children, US CDC Central Asia Office, The CDC Foundation

National Public Health Agencies (over 90 countries)

Albania, Algeria, Anguilla, Armenia, Austria, Belgium, Belize, Benin, Bermuda, Burundi, Cambodia, Cameroon, Canada, Cayman Islands, Congo, Democratic Republic, Croatia, Denmark, Djibouti, Dominican Republic, Ireland, Egypt, Ethiopia, Fiji, Finland, France, Gambia, Georgia, Germany, Ghana, Gibraltar, Guatemala, Guinea, Guyana, Honduras, Indonesia, Ireland, Italy, Kazakhstan, Kenya, Kosovo, Kyrgyzstan, Latvia, Lebanon, Liberia, Libya, Luxembourg, Macedonia, Malaysia, Malta, Mexico, Moldova, Montenegro, Monteserrat, Mozambique, Myanmar, Namibia, Netherlands, Nigeria, North Macedonia, Norway, Pakistan, Palestine, Panama, Peru, Philippines, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Rwanda, Saint Helena, Ascension and Tristan da Cunha, Saudi Arabia, Serbia, Slovenia, South Africa, Spain, Sweden, Tajikistan, Thailand, Togo, Tunisia, Türkiye, Turks and Caicos Islands, Uganda, Ukraine, United Kingdom, United States (CDC), Uzbekistan, Viet Nam, Virgin Islands, British, Zambia

Field Epidemiology Training Programs (FETPs)

The African Field Epidemiology Training Network (AFENET) United States Epidemic Intelligence Service (EIS) European CDC Fellowship Programme (EPIET/EUPHEM) The Mediterranean and Black Sea Programme for Intervention Epidemiology Training (MediPIET) Central Asia Field Epidemiology Training Program (FETP), Central America FETP, United Kingdom, Nigeria, Liberia, The Gambia, Zambia, Rwanda, Namibia, Peru, Philippines, Saudi Arabia

Subnational health agencies

California DPH, New York DOH, Colorado DPHE, Arizona DOH, Oregon (OHA), Kentucky DPH, Maryland DOH, Alaska DHSS, Hawaii DOH, Illinois DPH, Indiana DPH, Kansas DHE, Massachusetts DPH, Michigan DHHS, New Jersey DOH, Pennsylvania DOH, Tennessee DOH, Virginia DOH, Wisconsin DHS, District of Columbia (D.C.) Asia/Pacific subnational agencies

Northern Territories, Australia Department of Health, Republic of Karakalpakstan, Uzbekistan Andijan AIDS Center, Uzbekistan Almaty City AIDS Center, Kazakhstan Khodjan Department of Health Dushanbe City Desinfection Center, Tajikistan Osh Sanitary Epidemiological Station, Kyrgyzstan Batken Sanitary Epidemiological Station, Kyrgyzstan Health Department of Sindh, Pakistan Health Department of Balochistan, Pakistan Kala Azar Medical Research Center, Muzaffarpur, Bihar, Pakistan Provincial Public Health Department, Punjab, Pakistan Rawalpindi Health Department, Pakistan Lahore Health Department, Pakistan Karachi Health Department, Pakistan Faisalabad Health Department, Pakistan Peshawar Health Department, Pakistan Muzaffarabad Health Department, Pakistan Hyderabad Health Department, Pakistan Mansehra Health Department, Pakistan Local Government of Bais City, Philippines Local Government Unit of Santa Marcela, Philippines Department of Health - Center for Health Development Metro Manila, Philippines Bakan Operational District, Pursat Province, Cambodia Public Health Center of Bantaeng Regency, Indonesia Samarinda Health District, Indonesia Yogyakarta City Health Office, Indonesia S. K. Lerik Hospital, Indonesia
